templates.subject: Understanding Scenith Pricing: Finding the Right Plan for Your Creative Journey
templates.htmlContent:
Which Scenith Plan
Is Right for You?

A thoughtful guide to help you decide

Hey {{userName}},

We know pricing decisions aren't always straightforward. You're probably wondering: "Which plan actually makes sense for what I'm trying to build?"

Let's break it down in a way that actually helps you make the right choice for your creative work.

💭 How to Think About Our Plans

Your content creation frequency determines your plan. Ask yourself: "How often do I want to publish?"

Real Scenarios, Real Solutions

📈

"I'm building a consistent presence"

Publishing weekly content, growing an audience, using AI voices with emotion presets.

Best fit: Creator

🚀

"Content creation is my business"

Daily publishing, multiple projects, client work, or producing at scale.

Best fit: Studio

‚ùì The Real Question to Ask Yourself

"How much time am I currently wasting on content creation bottlenecks?"

If you're spending hours recording voiceovers, hiring voice artists, or waiting for approvals‚Äîthe right plan isn't a cost, it's a time-saver that pays for itself What's your time worth?

Quick Answers to Common Questions

"Can I start with Basic and upgrade later?"

Absolutely. Many creators do exactly this. Start free, see if Scenith fits your workflow, then upgrade.

"Is the quality really the same across plans?"

Yes! Basic users access the same 40+ premium AI voices across 20+ languages. You get emotion presets (Happy, Calm, Professional, etc.), voice filtering, and commercial use rights. The only difference is monthly character limits‚Äîquality stays premium for everyone.

Ready to choose?

See detailed pricing and
start creating today

View Full Pricing Details

Still not sure? That's completely normal. Reply to this email and tell me what you're trying to build. We'll personally help you figure out which plan makes sense‚Äîno sales pressure, just honest advice.

‚Äì The Scenith Team

Pricing ‚Ä¢ Contact Us

‚ùì Frequently Asked Questions

How do the character limits work?

Each word you convert to speech uses approximately 5-6 characters. With 50,000 characters/month, you can create about 8,000-10,000 words of voiceover content.

What languages are supported?

We support 30+ languages including English, Hindi, Spanish, French, German, Japanese, and many more with native-quality voices.

What if I need more characters?

You can upgrade to our Creator (60,000 chars) or Studio (200,000 chars) bundles anytime for even more capacity and additional features.
